revision.text:
The '''2015 Iglesia ni Cristo leadership controversy''' is a dispute between senior members of the [[Christian denomination]] [[Iglesia ni Cristo]] (INC) in the Philippines. In July 2015, it was reported that the INC had [[Excommunication|expelled]] some of its ministers, along with high-profile members Felix Nathaniel "Angel" and [[Cristina Villanueva Manalo|Cristina "Tenny" Manalo]]. Angel is the brother of current INC Executive Minister [[Eduardo Manalo]] and Tenny is the mother of Eduardo, and widow of former Executive Minister [[Eraño Manalo]].<ref name=supporters>{{cite news|last1=Gamil|first1=Jaymee|title=Supporters gather outside home of Manalo matriarch|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707216/supporters-gather-outside-home-of-manalo-matriarch-son#ixzz3gjR4fqaK|accessdate=23 July 2015|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=23 July 2015}}</ref>
Angel and Tenny were expelled from the INC for allegedly "sowing disunity" in the Church. The INC administration released a statement claiming that Eduardo had agreed to the expulsion of his brother and mother from the INC, as decided upon by its overall leadership.<ref name=supporters/> However, both Angel and Tenny claimed their lives were threatened by the Iglesia administration. Angel and Tenny had reportedly been illegally detained at the Iglesia's Central Office Complex in [[Tandang Sora]], [[Quezon City]], and that at least ten ministers of the Church were missing and alleged to have been abducted.<ref name=coverup>{{cite news|last1=Cayabyab|first1=Marc Jayson|title=Manalo kin held to cover up INC scam?|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707184/manalo-kin-held-to-stop-them-from-exposing-inc-mess-minister|accessdate=23 July 2015|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=23 July 2015}}</ref>
Former INC ministers Roel Rosal and Isaias Samson, Jr., claimed that the ''Sanggunián'' (the highest administrative council of the INC) had unlawfully abducted and detained ministers, along with members of the Manalo family, to cover up corruption surrounding the chief auditor, Glicerio "Jun" Santos, Jr.<ref name=Inquirer6>{{cite web|last1=Quismundo|first1=Tarra|title=SuspendedINC minister details detention|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707291/suspended-inc-minister-details-detention|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> On July 24, 2015, INC, represented by Glicerio B. Santos, IV, head counsel and son of Santos, Jr.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Rufo|first1=Aries|title=Part 1: Who is Glicerio Santos Jr in the Iglesia ni Cristo?|url=http://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/investigative/100947-part-1-glicerio-santos-jr-inc|accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref> filed a libel complaint against Samson.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|title=Iglesia ni Cristo sues expelled minister for libel|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100613-iglesia-ni-cristo-libel-isaias-samson-pasugo?cp_rap_source=ymlScrolly#cxrecs_s|accessdate=27 July 2015}}</ref> Detained INC minister Lowell Menorca stated that he was forcibly detained by the INC administration, and was kidnapped at gunpoint by police officers in the employ of INC leaders and was forced to deny his captivity under duress.<ref name="rappler1"/> Menorca later fled to [[Canada]] and filed for refugee status, which was granted in 2018, with the [[Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada]] stating: “When the panel considers the links between the INC and the law enforcement authorities in the Philippines, the general climate of impunity that pervades Philippines law enforcement, particularly with respect to the issue of extrajudicial killing, and the level of corruption that exists in the Philippines government and law enforcement apparatus, the panel is satisfied Menorca would be unable to avail himself of state protection, from the risks that he fears in that country..."<ref>{{cite web |title=INC ex-minister granted asylum in Canada – report |url=http://www.manilatimes.net/inc-ex-minister-granted-asylum-canada-report/377814/ |accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref> {{toclimit|3}}
==Overview==
===Angel and Tenny Manalo=== On July 22, 2015, a video was uploaded to [[YouTube]] featuring Felix Nathaniel "Angel" Manalo, the brother to nominal INC leader [[Eduardo V. Manalo]] and a former General Manager of GemNet (formerly the TV station of INC, replaced by [[INCTV]]), along with his mother, Cristina "Tenny" Manalo, the widow of Eraño Manalo.<ref name=Youtube>{{cite web|title=Bro EGM's family - Call for help|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSbDN7vEYdw|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> In the video, they claimed their lives had been threatened by the Iglesia leadership, along with that of Angel's sister, [[Lottie Hemedez]]. Tenny Manalo also claimed that there had been a mass [[kidnapping]] of ministers who had not been accounted for, implying that their disappearance somehow traced to the INC leadership, and that she had not been able to speak to Eduardo V. Manalo.<ref name=ABS-CBN>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/07/23/15/iglesia-ni-cristo-expel-tenny-manalo-son-angel |title=Iglesia ni Cristo expels Tenny Manalo, son Angel |website=ABS-CBN News |date=1914-07-27 |accessdate=2015-12-24}}</ref>
However, INC denies the claims. Bienvenido Santiago, INC's chief evangelist, announced a few hours after the video's release that INC was expelling Cristina "Tenny" Manalo, along with Felix Nathaniel "Angel" Manalo, for allegedly causing divisions in the Church and wanting to seize power.<ref name="Rappler">{{cite web |last1=Francisco |first1=Katerina |first2=Chay F. |last2=Hofileña |url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100225-iglesia-cristo-manalo-expel-mother-brother |title=Iglesia ni Cristo head expels mother, brother |work=[[Rappler]] |date=23 July 2015 |accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> Santiago claimed that their video was a sympathy ploy to gather support to meddle in the leadership of the INC and that the INC administration was acting on the wishes of [[Eduardo V. Manalo]] to prevent discord in the Church. Edwil Zabala, a spokesman for the INC stated that the INC would consider having Tenny and Angel Manalo return to the Church if they would pledge to uphold and obey their teachings.<ref name="Rappler 3">{{cite web|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|title=Iglesia ni Cristo head expels mother, brother|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100225-iglesia-cristo-manalo-expel-mother-brother|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> Marco Eraño "Marc" Villanueva Manalo and Lolita "Lottie" Manalo Hemedez, the younger siblings of Eduardo and Angel, were also expelled.<ref>{{cite web|title=Iglesia Ni Cristo announces expulsion of Eduardo Manalo's mother, siblings|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/527206/news/nation/watch-iglesia-ni-cristo-announces-expulsion-of-eduardo-manalo-s-mother-siblings|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref>
After the response from the INC, an unidentified individual was photographed holding a sign saying "''Tulong'', hostage ''kami''" ([[Tagalog language|Tagalog]]: ''Help, we're [held] hostage'') in a building that is part of the INC Central Office in Tandang Sora, Quezon City. An interview to Angel Manalo later confirmed that it was just a "playing child" who was the promotor of the sign and is nothing serious at all. <ref>{{cite web|title=Sign outside INC building: 'Tulong, hostage kami'|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100237-iglesia-cristo-help-hostage-sign|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> When contacted by reporters, INC spokesman Edwil Zabala referred them to a CD recording of Santiago's statement regarding the expulsions.
In a press briefing that same afternoon, Santiago confirmed the expulsions. Santiago said in Tagalog, "Painful as it is to our brother Eduardo Manalo, they have decided to expel those who have been causing division within the Church. That is why in future worship services of the Church of Christ, from this day, the Overall Leadership will let this be known by all of our brothers".<ref name="whereare">{{cite news | first1=Marc Jayson | last1=Cayabyab | url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707189/where-are-the-missing-ministers | title=‘Where are the missing ministers?’ | publisher=Inquirer.net | date=23 July 2015 | accessdate=23 July 2015 | last2=Sauler | first2=Erika}}</ref>
[[File:JfCiudadINC9725PhilArenafvf 22.JPG|200px|thumbnail|Angel Manalo has criticized the Church's decision to build the [[Philippine Arena]] and suggested that funds used to build the sports venue could have been used to build more houses of worship.<ref name=hitscorruption/>]]
The [[Philippine National Police]], through its Quezon City Police District (QCPD), sent its personnel to the INC compound on July 23. They were able to contact Angel in the evening, and Angel himself talked to the reporters around 1:00 [[Philippine Standard Time|PST]], denying he was detained and saying that sign pleading for help was done by a child joking around. QCPD Joel Pagdilao said that the police is ruling out case of abduction and described the concerned persons inside as peaceful and free.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sabillo|first1=Kristine Angeli|title=Police to ensure safety amid INC dispute — Malacañang|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707436/police-to-ensure-safety-amid-inc-dispute-malacanang|accessdate=24 July 2015|publisher=Inquirer.net|date=24 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|title=Cops rule out abduction in Iglesia compound|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100298-iglesia-cristo-police-tandang-sora-compound?cp_rap_source=ymlScrolly|accessdate=24 July 2015|publisher=Rappler|date=24 July 2015}}</ref>
Angel Manalo also spoke to the reporters and criticized the Church's Sanggunian, denied that he is challenging the leadership of his brother, [[Eduardo Manalo]]. He also advised his brother Eduardo against trusting people within the Sanggunian he alleged to be corrupt. He also criticized the decision's to build the [[Philippine Arena]] instead of more houses of worship. He lamented the situation that his Church is facing saying in Tagalog, "Why is it that these days, there are many anomalies? Others might say we're challenging our brother. No, we love our brother. But our problem is with people around him." He added "The doctrine of the Iglesia ni Cristo is now damaged. In the same way that you looked up to us before, now you can see there are many anomalies. There are many acts of corruption in the Church. That's what we want to avoid" <ref name=hitscorruption>{{cite news|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|title=Manalo brother hits Iglesia ni Cristo 'corruption'|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100304-manalo-brother-iglesia-cristo-corruption|accessdate=24 July 2015|publisher=Rappler|date=24 July 2015}}</ref>
On December 15, 2015, church guards prevented Manalo and his housekeepers from allowing members of the media to enter their ancestral house in Tandang Sora, following the inspection of the sheriff of the Quezon City RTC.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/747894/angel-manalo-protests-illegal-fencing-off-of-inc-manalo-compound|title=Angel Manalo protests ‘illegal’ fencing off of Iglesia family compound|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|last=Sauler|first=Erika|date=15 December 2015|accessdate=16 December 2015}}</ref> The court inspection was requested by church officials in order to identify the occupants of property, following reports that unknown masked and hooded persons were going in and out of the compound which is right beside the INC central office, as well as in response to several ex-Marines who tried to go inside the INC Compound, led by renegade soldier Capt. Nicanor Faeldon, and who were only stopped by INC security. INC spokesman Zabala also claimed that the #36 TS property was owned by INC.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.journal.com.ph/news/top-stories/inc-cleared|title=INC cleared|publisher=Journal Online|last=Gutierrez|first=Paul M.|date=17 December 2015|accessdate=18 December 2015}}</ref> Angel Manalo also protested the construction of the high fences in the compound.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.rappler.com/nation/116062-angel-manalo-eduardo-manalo-barriers-tandang-sora-residence|title=Angel Manalo to brother Eduardo: Stop building barriers in 36 Tandang Sora|publisher=Rappler|date=15 December 2015|accessdate=16 December 2015}}</ref> The next day, the Quezon City RTC branch 22 ordered INC to restore the electricity supply of the compound, remove and dismantle the blocking fences, and remove the guardhouse and portalet that blocked the vehicle gate #3 of the Manalo's home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/116116-court-iglesia-blockade-electricity-manalo-tandang-sora|title=Court to INC: Remove blockade, restore power at Tandang Sora|publisher=Rappler|last=Cepeda|first=Mara|date=17 December 2015|accessdate=17 December 2015}}</ref>
INC planned to file an ejectment case against Manalo and Hemedez if the siblings refused to leave their residence in Tandang Sora.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://politics.com.ph/walang-kapatid-kapatid-inc-files-ejectment-case-vs-expelled-manalos/|title=Walang kapatid, kapatid: INC to file ejectment case vs. expelled Manalos|publisher=Politiko|date=January 15, 2016|accessdate=January 15, 2016}}</ref> On her part, Manalo-Hemedez said that she is the real owner of the #36 Tandang Sora compound, having been owned the property since 1983. She maintained that she and her household would not leave the compound.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/119209-lottie-iglesia-ni-cristo-erano-manalo|title=Lottie Manalo to Iglesia: We are heirs of 'God's Messenger'|publisher=''[[Rappler]]''|last=Francisco|first=Katarina|date=January 16, 2016|accessdate=March 22, 2016}}</ref>
Presidential aspirant [[Roy Señeres]] visited the compound in January 2016. Guards barred Señeres from entering and refused to let him provide the occupants with food and bottled water.<ref>{{cite news|title=Señeres dinedma ng Manalo family|publisher=''Inquirer Bandera''|date=January 10, 2016}}</ref>
===Ministers=== That same day, allegations from former and current INC ministers claimed that the Manalo family were hostages. Roel Rosal, a former Iglesia ni Cristo minister who stated that he and his wife were expelled from the church for trying to expose corruption,<ref name=Inquirer4>{{cite web|last1=Cayabyab|first1=Marc Jayson|title=Manalo kin held to cover up INC scam?|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707184/manalo-kin-held-to-stop-them-from-exposing-inc-mess-minister#ixzz3ghmIkmLc|website=Inquirer.net|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> made a public statement that ten ministers along with the Manalos were under house arrest at the INC Central Office, at the behest of INC auditor general Glicerio B. "Jun" Santos, Jr. in order to prevent the revelation of financial corruption by Santos and his staff. Rosal claims that Santos has pilfered and misused church offerings, and is holding the Manalos for "revenge."<ref name=Inquirer2>{{cite web|last1=Cayabyab|first1=Marc Jayson|title=Manalo kin held to cover up INC scam?|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707184/manalo-kin-held-to-stop-them-from-exposing-inc-mess-minister#ixzz3ghmIkmLc|website=Inquirer|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> Supporters of Tenny and Angel Manalo gathered outside the compound demanding to know the whereabouts of the Manalos and missing ministers. [[GMA News and Public Affairs|GMA News]] reported that they saw an individual resembling Angel Manalo inside of the house, along with guards wielding long firearms.<ref name=GMANews>{{cite web|last1=Medina|first1=Andrei|title=Ka Angel, Ka Tenny’s supporters gather outside Manalo compound |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/527318/news/nation/ka-angel-ka-tenny-s-supporters-gather-outside-manalo-compound |publisher=GMA News Online |accessdate=29 October 2015}}</ref> [[File:Dasmariñas jf9441 13.JPG|thumbnail|[[Dasmariñas]] the city where INC minister Menorca was reported to have been arrested.]] At least ten ministers are reported to be missing according to expelled minister Roel Rosal.<ref name=coverup/> One of the reported ministers, Lowell Menorca II was reported to be arrested by the [[Philippine National Police]] in [[Dasmariñas]] after two construction workers were allegedly threatened by Menorca with a grenade. Menorca's lawyer, Allen Blair Boy from the New Era University Legal Aid, questioned whether he was abducted and Boy said that Menorca told him that he was indeed arrested. It is not clear why he was in Dasmariñas, because Menorca is based in [[Sorsogon]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Allegedly abducted Iglesia minister nabbed by Dasmariñas PNP|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/527330/news/nation/allegedly-abducted-iglesia-minister-nabbed-by-dasmarinas-pnp|accessdate=23 July 2015|publisher=GMA News|date=23 July 2015}}</ref>
On July 29, 2015, Rosal reiterated his claims against the INC leadership. He also stated that the Quezon City Police were taking sides in the conflict by supporting the INC administration, and denying Angel and Tenny Manalo deliveries of food and water. Rosal also claimed that the captives in the Manalo compound were running out of food and water.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Araja|first1=Rio N.|title=QC cops hit for INC bias|url=http://manilastandardtoday.com/2015/07/29/qc-cops-hit-for-inc-bias/|website=Manila Standard|accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref>
In a press conference held July 23, INC minister Isaias Samson, Jr. cited Menorca's case alleging that the military had taken him from Sorsogon to Dasmariñas. He said that the missing ministers were held in Rosalia Compound and Caringal in Quezon City.<ref name=govint/>
Arnel Tumanan,<ref name=supporters/> Joven Sepillo of [[Tacloban]], and Nolan Olarte of [[Cebu]] are among the other reported missing ministers.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Meruenas|first1=Mark|title=DOJ steps in, orders NBI to probe ‘abduction’ of Iglesia ni Cristo ministers|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/527722/news/nation/doj-steps-in-orders-nbi-to-probe-abduction-of-iglesia-ni-cristo-ministers|accessdate=24 July 2015}}</ref>
INC, thru attorney Serafin Cuevas, Jr., had also filed [[libel]] charges against Samson and Joy Yuson, former administrative coordinator of GEM TV, then the TV arm of INC, for accusing INC and its Sanggunian members of involvement in various anomalies and alleged abductions of ministers,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Chavez|first1=Chito|title=INC files libel charges vs expelled minister|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/inc-files-libel-charges-vs-expelled-minister/|publisher=''Manila Bulletin''|accessdate=24 July 2015}}</ref> preliminary investigations for the said case started on September 16, 2015 at the Quezon City RTC.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|title=Former Iglesia minister appears in court over libel complaint|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/106102-iglesia-ni-cristo-isaias-samson-libel-preliminary-investigation|publisher=''Rappler''|accessdate=September 17, 2015}}</ref>
Menorca released a video on October 23, 2015, a few days after he was allegedly rescued from abduction by the Sanggunian and the filing of writ of ''habeas corpus'' by his brother Anthony and sister-in-law Jungko Azuka. In it he supported the claim that he was abducted and illegally detained from July 25-October 21 in the Central Compound together with his wife, children and housekeeper, and orchestrated by the Sanggunian. He further claimed that he and his family never asked to the Church to give them a house, or to be put into protective custody. The supposed rescue of the Menorca Family was first supported by attorney Trixie Cruz-Angeles, the lawyer of the INC's expelled ministers, including Jun Samson.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/734041/ex-iglesia-ni-cristo-minister-lowell-menorca-confirms-abduction|title=Ex-Iglesia ni Cristo minister Lowell Menorca confirms abduction|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|first=Yuji Vincent|last=Gonzales|date=2015-10-23|accessdate=2015-10-24}}</ref>
During the alleged illegal detention they claimed to have not been allowed to leave the premises nor had the right to accept guests. Cellphones and gadgets were also said to not be allowed in the premises. After the video was uploaded, INC expelled him and his family. The expulsion papers was signed by minister Radel Cortez.<ref name= "Rappler 1">{{cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/investigative/110393-iglesia-ni-cristo-minister-menorca-illegally-detained|title=Ex-INC minister rescued after 'illegal detention'|first=Chay|last=Hofileña|publisher=Rappler|date=2015-10-23|accessdate=2015-10-24}}</ref>
===Isaias Samson, Jr.=== Isaias Samson, Jr., was a second-generation INC minister, former Sanggunian member and head of Foreign Department. He had been demoted due to some cases in his department to be an editor of INC's ''Pasugo'' magazine (a section of INC's Evangelism Department) and part of the Philippine government's Official Prayer Day and regular minister during prayers in SONA. He held a press conference on July 23 confirming his own detention, stating that he and his family were placed under house arrest by the INC administration, with the involvement of military and police officials. Samson stated that he was detained because of his opposition to Santos and gave a rough estimate of the amount of fund misused by Santos as in the "millions" of pesos, but he gave no evidence. Samson also stated that communication from the outside world was cut off and that passports, computers, phones and other electronic devices were confiscated. He was accused by INC leadership of being "Antonio Ebangelista," a pseudonym used by a minister who had written critical articles that reveal details on Church administration and Santos, a charge Samson denies. Samson and his family escaped by telling the guards they wanted to go to church service. Samson described his imprisonment as "unlawful detention," and called some in the INC administration "dishonest," but stated that he retained his faith in the INC.<ref name="Inquirer6"/> Samson later claimed corruption within the INC leadership regarding misuse of funds, such as in the "Lingap sa Mamamayan" fund, use of private planes and oil business. On July 25, 2015, INC spokesman Edwil Zabala stated that Samson and his family were expelled from the church for refusing to submit to authority.<ref>{{cite web|title=Former ‘Pasugo’ editor expelled from Iglesia Ni Cristo|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/527642/news/nation/former-pasugo-editor-expelled-from-iglesia-ni-cristo|accessdate=24 July 2015}}</ref>
Samson was replaced by Dennis C. Lovendino, a minister who became the new editor of ''Pasugo'' as of the June 2015 issue.
In a separate interview with [[CNN Philippines]], INC Spokesperson Zabala said that the so-called house arrest of the family of Samson, Jr. was a disciplinary act within the Church (preventive suspension) in which Samson was under investigation, due to his connection to the group in social media that was claiming corruption issues inside the church.
In November 17, the Department of Justice dismissed the criminal raps filed by Samson and fellow expelled member Lito de Luna Fruto against the INC leaders for lack of [[probable cause]]. Both Samson and Fruto accused INC of holding them against their will.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/11/17/15/doj-junks-criminal-raps-vs-iglesia-execs|title=DOJ junks criminal raps vs Iglesia execs|last=Reformina|first=Ina|publisher=ABS-CBN News|date=2015-11-17|accessdate=2015-11-18}}</ref>
==Investigations== On July 24, 2015, the [[Department of Justice (Philippines)|Department of Justice]] ordered the [[National Bureau of Investigation (Philippines)|National Bureau of Investigation]] (NBI) to investigate allegations of abduction of INC members. However it added that it would not interfere.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Francisco |first1=Katerina |title=DOJ orders probe into Iglesia ni Cristo 'abduction' |url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100344-doj-probe-iglesia-cristo-abduction |accessdate=24 July 2015 |publisher=Rappler |date=24 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Loyola |first1=Jun |title=VIDEO | DOJ orders probe of INC 'detentions, abductions' but Angel Manalo snubs NBI team |url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/114814/video--doj-orders-probe-of-inc-detentions-abductions-but-angel-manalo-snubs-nbi-team |accessdate=July 27, 2015 |publisher=News5 Interaksyon |date=July 27, 2015}}</ref> On July 27, 2015, in a statement by Manuel Eduarte, chief of the NBI Anti-Organized Transnational Crime Division, said that the NBI concluded that insufficient evidence showed that the Iglesia ni Cristo abducted some of its ministers.<ref>{{cite news |title=NBI on Iglesia ni Cristo 'abduction': Case closed |url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100695-nbi-iglesia-ni-cristo-abduction-case-closed |accessdate=27 July 2015 |publisher=Rappler |date=27 July 2015}}</ref> However, on July 29, 2015, Former Justice department secretary (now Senator) [[Leila de Lima]] clarified that the case had not been closed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Meruenas|first1=Mark|title=De Lima: NBI probe on Iglesia ni Cristo 'abduction' not yet closed|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/530630/news/nation/de-lima-nbi-probe-on-iglesia-ni-cristo-abduction-not-yet-closed|accessdate=7 August 2015|publisher=GMA News|date=29 July 2015}}</ref>
Former Vice President [[Jejomar Binay]] criticized de Lima's "unwarranted statements" asserting that the case remained open and noted her statement contradicts the reported findings of NBI Anti-Organized Transnational Crime Division. "By your actuations, you are promoting the image of disunity, discord and even corruption in the INC to its clear prejudice and detriment," Binay said that De Lima must respect the [[separation of church and state]] and "unwarranted interference" from the government in the church must not happen. Binay also describe De Lima's dealings with the Iglesia ni Cristo controversy as similar to what he describes as a "[[Character assassination|policy of demolition]]" targeted towards his own person.<ref>{{cite news|title=VP to de Lima: Stop meddling with INC|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/vp-to-de-lima-stop-meddling-with-inc/207132/|accessdate=7 August 2015|publisher=The Manila Times|date=6 August 2015}}</ref>
===Protests in response to the investigation=== {{main article|2015 Iglesia ni Cristo protests}} On late evening of August 27, about 2,000 Iglesia members led by INC spokesman Edwil Zabala held a vigil outside the [[Department of Justice (Philippines)|Department of Justice]] office and later moved to [[EDSA (road)|EDSA]]. The demonstrators protested against the government agency, led by De Lima, for allegedly persecuting their church and called for upholding the [[separation of church and state]]. They also called for the agency to prioritize more important issues.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Esmaquel|first1=Paterno II|title=Iglesia ni Cristo rallies flock: ‘Inaapi tayo!’|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/104004-iglesia-ni-cristo-zabala-doj-rally-persecution|accessdate=28 August 2015|publisher=Rappler|date=28 August 2015}}</ref>
==Reactions==
===Iglesia ni Cristo===
====Religious leaders==== INC general evangelist Bienvenido Santiago on July 23, 2015, responding to allegations made by the Manalos in a July 22 video, dismissed the accusations that some INC ministers were abducted and claimed that the two were attacking the church to make it appear that it was involved in the abductions. He also added that the video was an attempt to rally support from church members and to distract the church's management. Santiago said that the church's decision to expel the two Manalos was to show that the INC is a religion that follows the teachings of God found in the Bible, not a business.<ref name=whereare/>
In a morning Sunday worship in July 26, INC executive minister Eduardo Manalo repeated that members should strictly follow the church's leadership and rules to attain salvation.<ref name=pdievm>{{cite news|last1=Reyes-Estrope|first1=Carmela|title=Manalo asks Iglesia ni Cristo members to follow church leadership|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707847/manalo-asks-iglesia-ni-cristo-members-to-follow-church-leadership|accessdate=26 July 2015|publisher=Inquirer Central Luzon|date=26 July 2015}}</ref>
The media reported that an INC member said that provincial ministers issued a set of ''tagubilin'' (instructions) towards the church's members during the weekend ahead of the church's 101st anniversary celebrations to be held in July 26 in [[Ciudad de Victoria]] complex in [[Bulacan]]. Among these reported instructions were that members decline media inquiries and travel by private cars to the celebrations. During the centennial celebrations, members were provided with service vehicles. Stickers for vehicles with "One with EVM" were reportedly distributed.<ref name=pdievm2>{{cite news|last1=Cinco|first1=Maricar|title=Iglesia ni Cristo members told: carry ‘EVM’ tarps; shun media interviews|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707823/inc-members-told-carry-evm-tarps-shun-media-interviews|accessdate=26 July 2015|publisher=Inquirer Southern Luzon|date=26 July 2015}}</ref>
The media reported an unusually high number of worshipers and vehicles at the INC church in [[Los Baños, Laguna|Los Baños]]. Several taurpalins bearing the words "One with EVM" were posted outside the building.<ref name=pdievm2/>
====Expelled members==== Expelled INC minister Roel and his spouse, Shirley Rosal told reporters on July 23, 2015 that at least 10 ministers were under [[house arrest]]. Roel Rosal claimed that auditor Jun Santos and his staff were using donations for the INC to purchase [[luxury car|luxury vehicles]]. He also said that Angel and Tenny Manalo were hostages. Roel said that the expulsion of the Manalos might have been influenced by a "third party" in the church administration.<ref name=supporters/><ref name=coverup/>
Isaias Samson, Jr. at a July 23 press conference, said that government intervention in the crisis would help resolve the issue.<ref name=govint>{{cite news|last1=Torres-Tupas|first1=Tetch|title=INC crisis: Suspended minister urges gov’t intervention|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707267/inc-crisis-suspended-minister-urges-govt-intervention|accessdate=23 July 2015|publisher=Inquirer.net|date=23 July 2015|language=English, Tagalog}}</ref> Samson was expelled from the INC the day after his press conference.
====Other members and supporters==== Fewer than 12 supporters of the church wearing white armbands organized a vigil in support of the Manalos in front of the INC compound in Tandang Sora.<ref name=supporters/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|title=Frustrated INC members back leader's kin|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100257-inc-members-manalo-house-rally?cp_rap_source=ymlScrolly#cxrecs_s|accessdate=24 July 2015|publisher=Rappler|date=23 July 2015}}</ref> By 2:00 am of July 25, no INC member was seen camping outside the compound.<ref name=novigil>{{cite news|last1=Yee|first1=Jovic|title=No vigil outside Angel Manalo’s residence|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/707548/no-vigil-outside-angel-manalos-residence|accessdate=25 July 2015|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=25 July 2015}}</ref>
Some members used social media to express their support for Eduardo V. Manalo and the Sanggunian. Some members changed their profile photo to an image bearing the words "I am one with EVM," in support of the leadership of Eduardo Manalo.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mateo|first1=Janvic|title=Iglesia rift widens online|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/07/26/1481030/iglesia-rift-widens-online|accessdate=26 July 2015|publisher=The Philippine Star|date=26 July 2015}}</ref>
On July 25, 2015, Louie Cayabyab, the minister of the Iglesia ni Cristo locale in [[Fremont, California]], resigned his position as minister as a response to the expulsions of Samson and Tenny and Angel Manalo. Cayabyab stated "Beloved brethren, there are two circulars that are supposed to be read this morning. The first circular is about the expulsion from the Church of the wife and children of Bro. Erano G. Manalo. And another circular is the expulsion from the Church of Bro. Isaias T. Samson Jr., former editor-in-chief of the ''Pasugo''. I decided, brethren, that I won’t read those circulars. You might be asking, 'why?' Because in my heart, in my heart of hearts, I can’t take it. It is, it is just so so difficult to betray one’s heart..."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/528746/news/nation/iglesia-ni-cristo-minister-in-california-quits-post |title=Iglesia ni Cristo minister in California quits post | News | GMA News Online |website=Gmanetwork.com |date= |accessdate=2015-12-24}}</ref> While Cayabyab asked INC members to remain in the church, he urged them to support peaceful vigils held in their areas, and implored them to support brethren in the Philippines "who are risking their lives" to expose corruption and reform the church.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Esmaquel|first1=Paterno|title=US-based INC minister: 'Never my intention to quit'|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100595-iglesia-ni-cristo-minister-louie-cayabyab-quit|accessdate=27 July 2015}}</ref>
In response to Cayabyab's resignation, members of the INC in [[Northern California]], numbering in the "dozens," according to [[ABS-CBN News]], held a protest at the INC's main United States office in [[Burlingame, California]], demanding an investigation and tribunal into the corruption allegations, along with the reinstatement of Angel and Tenny Manalo.<ref>{{cite web|title=Surprising move: Iglesia ni Cristo members in California hold protest|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/global-filipino/07/27/15/surprising-move-iglesia-ni-cristo-members-california-hold-protest|accessdate=27 July 2015}}</ref> About a week later those who were identified as having taken part in the protests were expelled from the church.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Conclara|first1=Rommel|title=INC expels members who joined protest in US|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/global-filipino/08/06/15/inc-expels-members-who-joined-protest-us|accessdate=7 August 2015|agency=ABS-CBN North America News Bureau|publisher=ABS-CBN News|date=6 August 2015}}</ref>
Members of INC from 26 ecclesiastical districts picketed the Department of Justice office in [[Manila]], when Secretary Leila de Lima, on her birthday, officially announced her 2016 senatorial bid. The assembly happened a few days after former minister Samson, Jr., his wife and son, filed illegal detention charges against eight members of the Sanggunian. A respondent of the case, Bienvenido Santiago, Sr., the church's general evangelist, wanted De Lima to focus instead on the SAF 44 case.<ref>{{cite web|title=Iglesia Ni Cristo Press Statement as read during Aug. 26 press conference|url=http://www.eaglenews.ph/iglesia-ni-cristo-press-statement-as-read-during-aug-26-press-conference/|accessdate=August 27, 2015|publisher=Eagle News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Iglesia ni Cristo members: ‘Why, why, why, De Lima?’ |url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/103949-iglesia-ni-cristo-members-why-de-lima|accessdate=August 27, 2015|publisher=Rappler}}</ref>
====Net 25 TV interview with allegedly missing ministers==== In an interview with Eagle News Service/Net 25 on July 29, 2015, a broadcaster owned and operated by INC affiliate [[Eagle Broadcasting Corporation]], ministers Lowell "Boyet" Menorca II, Joel San Pedro, Jojo Nemis and Arnel Tumanan denied they were held captive or tortured. They also affirmed their loyalty to the church administration and executive minister [[Eduardo Manalo]] and that they were still church members. The ministers also stated that members should not believe the claims of abduction.<ref name="Eagle News">{{cite web|title=INC ministers come out in the open to say they were not abducted, hit lies spread in media|url=http://www.eaglenews.ph/inc-ministers-come-out-in-the-open-to-say-they-were-not-abducted-hit-lies-spread-in-media/|website=Eagle News|accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref>
However, Anthony Menorca, Boyet Menorca's brother, stated that his older brother was forced to deny his abduction because INC Sanggunian was holding Boyet Menorca's wife, Seiko Otsuka Menorca, and one year old child. Anthony stated that in a meeting with his brother, he told him "Binantaan kami ng kapatid ko na kami ay papatayin" ([[Tagalog language|Tagalog]]: ''"My brother warned us we will be killed"'') Anthony Menorca stated that he was in an undisclosed location and feared for the life of his brother.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Cepeda|first1=Mara|title=Sibling of ‘abducted’ minister to INC Council: Free my brother|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/101041-inc-lowell-menorca-brother-abduction|website=Rappler|accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref>
In a new video released after he was allegedly rescued from the captivity of the Sanggunian on October 21, Menorca clarified, claiming that everything he said in the interview on Net 25 were "scripted".<ref name= "Rappler 1"/>
====Interview with Boyet Menorca==== On August 1, 2015, Boyet Menorca, along with his wife and child, were interviewed in person outside the INC compound, wherein he denied all allegations of his abduction and pleaded for his brother to stop making claims. He added that he and his family voluntarily decided to stay within the compound because of safety concerns. He was worried that he could potentially be attacked in order to direct the resulting blame on the INC. After the interview, he and his family returned to the INC compound.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/531300/news/nation/iglesia-minister-lowell-menorca-ii-denies-church-holding-his-family-against-their-will|title=Iglesia minister Lowell Menorca II denies church holding his family against their will|date=3 August 2015|website=gmanetwork|accessdate=29 October 2015}}</ref> Later, Menorca stated the interview was held "under duress."<ref name="rappler1">{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/110561-lowell-menorca-iglesia-ni-cristo-abduction-story |title=Ex-minister Lowell Menorca recounts Iglesia 'detention' ordeal |website=Rappler.com |date= |accessdate=2015-12-24}}</ref>
====Menorca recounts capture and being held hostage==== On October 21, 2015, Lowell Menorca's brother Anthony petitioned the Supreme Court of the Philippines to issue writs of ''habeas corpus'' and ''amparo'' against the INC administration. The request was granted and on October 25, Menorca stated that he was illegally detained by INC, kidnapped by police officers allegedly in INC's employ and had been interrogated for 17 hours. He also stated that police officials tried to kill him afterwards using a hand grenade and that he had to beg for his life, successfully convincing a police officer allegedly hired to murder him not to go through with the killing.<ref name="rappler1"/>
====Menorca's arrest in connection with libel charges==== On January 20, 2016, on his way to the Court of Appeals to attend a hearing on the illegal detention case, policemen wearing civilian clothes and without badges led by Supt. Ed Leonardo and INC member, arrested Menorca on libel charges filed by the SCAN International in Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/551925/news/metro/manila-cops-arrest-ex-iglesia-minister-before-ca-appearance|title=Manila cops arrest ex-Iglesia minister before CA appearance|publisher=''[[GMA News]]''|date=20 January 2016|accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref> A standoff between the police, Menorca and his wife Jinky occurred along Roxas Boulevard and Quirino Avenue when Menorca refused the arrest and claimed that the court had not notified him of libel charges. After the commotion, 20 policemen in uniform showed up to arrest Menorca.<ref name="Menorca 2"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/757081/ex-iglesia-minister-lowell-menorca-surrenders|title=Ex-Iglesia minister Lowell Menorca surrenders|publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]''|date=20 January 2016|accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref> MPD Director Chief Supt. Rolando Nana stopped the standoff and told Menorca to go to MPD Station 5 for booking.<ref name="Menorca 2">{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/01/20/16/ex-inc-minister-menorca-arrested-on-way-to-court|title=Ex-INC minister Menorca arrested on way to court|publisher=''ABS-CBN News''|last=Placido|first=Dharel|date=20 January 2016|accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref>
The church, thru its spokesman Edwil Zabala, said the INC strongly denied any involvement with the standoff and told Menorca to face the libel charges against him.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/119633-iglesia-ni-cristo-lowell-menorca-arrest|title=Ex-INC minister Menorca arrested on the way to court|publisher=''Rappler''|date=20 January 2016|accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eaglenews.ph/iglesia-ni-cristo-official-press-statement/|title=Iglesia Ni Cristo Official Press Statement|publisher=''Eagle News''|date=20 January 2016|accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref>
====Menorca receives asylum in Canada==== Menorca fled to [[Vietnam]] in March 2016. Moises Tolentino Jr., a lawyer for the Iglesia ni Cristo responded that: "Beset by several libel suits and an adultery charge to boot, [Menorca] took the cowardly option. He took a hurried flight last night bound for Vietnam. He is now a fugitive from justice.." and "Menorca is supposed to be the aggrieved party. If they were sincere, if they believed that they were in the right, they should not leave the country. They should face all opportunities that should be given to respondents..."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/124970-lowell-menorca-fugitive-iglesia-ni-cristo|title=INC: Menorca a 'fugitive,' robbed Iglesia of chance to expose lies|last1=Francisco|first1=Katerina|publisher=[[Rappler]]|accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref> Menorca left Vietnam two weeks later and arrived in [[Vancouver]]. He then filed an application for refugee status with the [[Government of Canada]] claiming that his life and that of his family members were threatened by the administration of the Iglesia ni Cristo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/564567/ex-iglesia-ni-cristo-minister-menorca-now-a-refugee-in-canada/story/|title=Ex-Iglesia ni Cristo minister Menorca now a ‘refugee’ in Canada|publisher=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref> The [[Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada]] granted Menorca refugee status in 2018, stating that Menorca was "a person in need of protection from a risk of cruel and unusual treatment or punishment and a risk to his life."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://usa.inquirer.net/9888/canada-grants-asylum-iglesia-ni-cristo-dissident|title=Canada grants asylum to Iglesia Ni Cristo dissident|website=Inquirer.net|publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref> The IRB further stated, "When the panel considers the links between the INC and the law enforcement authorities in the Philippines, the general climate of impunity that pervades Philippines law enforcement particularly with respect to the issue of extrajudicial killing, and the level of corruption that exists in the Philippines government and law enforcement apparatus, the panel is satisfied [Menorca] would be unable to avail himself of state protection, from the risks that he fears in that country...." and that "[The INC's] power and influence extends to an ability to utilize [police] to target the claimant."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/refugee-philippines-church-lowell-menorca-1.4502614|title=Philippines-based church has 'means and motivation' to kill refugee if returned: IRB|last1=Rankin|first1=Eric|publisher=[[CBC News]]}}</ref>
===Governmental===
====Politicians==== The Bulacan chapter of the [[League of Municipalities of the Philippines]] posted tarpaulin streamers with photographs of 20 Bulacan mayors greeting the church on its 101st anniversary. [[Pandi, Bulacan|Pandi]] Mayor Enrico Roque, president of LMP Bulacan, said that the taurpalin was displayed to express their continuing friendship and respect to the church, in response to a report that a Bulacan mayor complained to church leaders that a minister from the INC attempted to extort money from the official. Roque said that the group says that they are in complete support of the INC.<ref name=pdievm/>
===Eli Soriano=== {{main article|Conflicts between Iglesia ni Cristo and Members Church of God International}} On his [[Twitter]] account, [[Eli Soriano]] of [[Members Church of God International]] expressed support for De Lima and urged De Lima not to resign.<ref>{{Cite tweet |user=BroEliSoriano |number=638556093388582912 |date=31 August 2015 |title=#DeLimaDoNotResign sana wag ipagpalit ni Pnoy ang prinsipyo ng Daang Matuwid sa kapritso ng mga ignm! Kailangan ng gov ang uri ni secdelima }}</ref>
===Other groups===
====Commission on Human Rights==== [[Commission on Human Rights (Philippines)|Commission on Human Rights]] chairperson José Luis Martin Gascon on July 24 said that the human rights body is monitoring the situation and was yet to launch a formal investigation. The rights body stated that it was avoiding a "premature conclusion" regarding the situation. It described the situation as "primarily a police matter" and is looking into allegations before taking action.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cepeda|first1=Mara|title=CHR: Iglesia alleged abductions still a 'police matter'|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/100343-chr-iglesia-abductions-police-matter|accessdate=24 July 2015|publisher=Rappler|date=24 July 2015}}</ref>
====Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines==== Lingayen-Dagupan Archbishop [[Socrates Villegas]], president of the [[Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines]], on July 24 requested prayers for Iglesia members. Villegas said in Tagalog, "As with their plea, I also ask that we pray for our brethren in the Iglesia ni Cristo... Brother Angel and his relatives are requesting prayers, that we pray for them." He added that he respected the decision of the Iglesia, which like the church, is "bound by rules and regulations".<ref>{{cite news|author1=ABS-CBNews.com|title=CBCP calls for prayers for INC|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/07/24/15/cbcp-calls-prayers-inc|accessdate=25 July 2015|date=24 July 2015|language=English, Tagalog}}</ref>
